arm_group.description: Subjects will position his/her neck in order to measure distance between the internal jugular and the carotid artery to determine if there is a maximal distance to target prior to cannulation

brief_summary.textblock:
Measurements will be made between the internal jugular vein and the carotid artery using an
      ultrasound machine as the subjects is asked to move and position his or her neck in various
      positions.

      It is hypothesized that by movements of the neck the investigators can maximize the distance
      between the internal jugular vein and the carotid artery to decrease inadvertent cannulation
      of the carotid artery to improve patient safety

clinical_study.brief_title: Optimal Neck Angle for Internal Jugular Cannulation

detailed_description.textblock:
Patients will be asked to participate in this trial if they are scheduled for surgery and
      they will have their neck repositioned in several ways using an ultrasound machine to
      measure the distance between the internal jugular vein and the carotic artery to determine
      maximal distance in order to insert a catheter prior to surgery

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

        Male and Females 18 years through 98 Scheduled for cardiac surgery Requires internal
        cannulation for their scheduled operative procedure -

        Exclusion Criteria:

        Individuals who refuse participation Subjects who already have had the internal jugular
        cannulated (line already present) History of carotid surgery History of Neck Surgery
        Individuals under 18 years of age

        -

intervention.description: Ultrasound guided measures of the neck of subjects undergoing cardiac surgery who need internal jugular vein cannulated

clinical_study.official_title: Optimal Angle For Internal Jugular Cannulation

overall_official.affiliation: Rutgers, Robert Wood Johnson Medical School

oversight_info.authority: United States: Food and Drug Administration

primary_outcome.description: Is there an angle to position ones neck which maximizes distances of carotid artery and internal jugular.
primary_outcome.measure: Find Optimal Angle for internal jugular cannulation

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: Using the Ultrasound machine and having the subject position his neck measurements will be taken between the internal jugular and carotid artery to determine what angle may provide the maximal distance in order to safely cannulated the internal jugular

clinical_study.source: Rutgers, The State University of New Jersey

lead_sponsor.agency: Rutgers, The State University of New Jersey

clinical_study.study_design: Endpoint Classification: Safety/Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Prevention
